API: Clickpost
Endpoint: POST /v4/create-order/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v4/create-order/

Summary: Create Order: Rest of the World
Description: This API takes the shipment details, drop information, pickup information and creates an order with specified carrier partner. This applies for shipments created and transported within North America, Europe, Middle East and South-East Asia and cross-border shipments.

Parameters:
  - username (query, REQUIRED, string): Username, unique to the enterprise profile
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Unique key to verify/authenticate the enterprise profile

Request Body:
  Content-Type: application/json
  Schema Fields:
    - RAW_BODY (string) [REQUIRED]: Payload of the request, containing all details of the order

metadata.summary: Create Order: Rest of the World

text:
API: Clickpost
Endpoint: GET /v4/create-order/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v4/create-order/

Summary: Fetch Order Details: Rest of the World
Description: Given an AWB and a carrier partner ID, fetch details of a shipment placed with that AWB. Works for shipments created and transported within North America, Europe, Middle East and South-East Asia and all cross-border shipments. Especially useful when an async order is placed with the V4 API.

Parameters:
  - username (query, optional, string): Username of the customer
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Unique license key provided by Clickpost for the enterprise, used for authentication
  - awb (query, REQUIRED, string): AWB of the order to receive details for
  - cp_id (query, REQUIRED, string): Partner ID of the courier responsible for delivering the shipment

Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: SPS Response ---
      "{
    "result": {
        "waybill": "SKY0000006574",
        "reference_number": "Test.SKYEXRVP.Order00002",

        "courier_partner_id": 325,

        "sort_code": null,
        "order_id": 147175531,
        "security_key": "4d36d09c-53b3-49f3-beb3-4eb8f884f941",
        "tracking_id": 487501569
    },
    "meta": {
        "status": 200,
        "success": true,
        "message": "Order Placed Successfully"
    }
}"

      --- Scenario: MPS Response ---
      "{
    "result": {
        "reference_number": "TestSolv00002",

        "waybill": "53433518935",

text:
API: Clickpost
Endpoint: POST /v2/tracking/awb-register/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v2/tracking/awb-register/

Summary: Register shipment for tracking: V2
Description: Register an AWB for tracking updates with Clickpost, given the AWB number, carrier partner ID, shipment information, pick-up and drop information, and additional details as input.

Parameters:
  - key (query, optional, string): Key that was provided by Clickpost

Request Body:
  Content-Type: application/json
  Schema Fields:
    - RAW_BODY (string) [REQUIRED]: Enter the request body

  Request Examples:
    --- Scenario: AWB Registration Payload ---
{
  "waybill": "ABCDRESDEFGHIJKL1257679",
  "cp_id": 1,
  "key": "42d42a34-ae09-4693-b20c-ae2624218a329",
  "account_code": "Fedex Domestic",
  "consumer_details": {
    "name": "Test Customer",
    "phone": "8080808080",
    "email": "test@clickpost.in"
  },
  "shipment_info": {
    "item": "Shirt",
    "order_type": "COD",
    "invoice_value": 1000,
    "reference_number": "123XYZ",
    "length": 10,
    "height": 10,
    "weight": 10,
    "breadth": 10,
    "drop_pincode": "110001",
    "pickup_pincode": "110001",
    "delivery_type": "FORWARD",
    "cod_amount": 1000.1,
    "drop_address": "Roots hacker Home, R 28, Second Floor, Nehru Enclace, Opposite Nehru Place, New Delhi 110001",
    "additional": {
      "items": [
        {
          "sku": "XYZ1",
          "description": "item1",
          "quantity": 1,
          "price": 200,
          "images": "<Image URL>",
          "return_days": 2,
          "additional": {
            "length": 10,
            "height": 10,
            "breadth": 10,
            "weight": 100
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  },
  "additional": {
    "order_date": "2017-02-14T18:00:00+05:30",
    "ship_date": "2017-02-14T23:00:00+05:30",
    "min_edd": 2,
    "max_edd": 4,
    "enable_whatsapp": false,
    "order_id": "ORDER-12"
  }
}


Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Newly Registered AWB ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 200,\n        \"message\": \"Success\",\n        \"success\": true\n    },\n    \"result\": {\n        \"tracking_id\": 491815220,\n        \"security_key\": \"c53b0171-9c6f-4045-92f8-03cadb5bc34f\"\n    }\n}"

      --- Scenario: Inactive/Non-existent Account or Courier Partner ID ---
      "  {\n      \"meta\": {\n          \"status\": 353,\n          \"message\": \"Clickpost Account: Inactive\",\n          \"success\": false\n      }\n  }"

      --- Scenario: Authentication Failed ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 500,\n        \"message\": \"Ops! Internal server error in Clickpost\",\n        \"success\": false\n    }\n}"

      --- Scenario: Already Registered AWB ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 303,\n        \"message\": \"Waybill already registered\",\n        \"success\": false\n    },\n    \"result\": {\n        \"tracking_id\": 491815220,\n        \"security_key\": \"c53b0171-9c6f-4045-92f8-03cadb5bc34f\"\n    }\n}"

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: GET /v1/cancel-order/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/cancel-order/

Summary: Cancellation
Description: Cancellation API allows you to cancel the shipment in the carrier partner's system

Parameters:
  - username (query, REQUIRED, string): The username of the Clickpost dashboard
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): API key given to enterprise by the Clickpost team
  - waybill (query, REQUIRED, string): Air Waybill of the order
  - cp_id (query, REQUIRED, integer): Carrier Partner ID of the carrier
  - account_code (query, REQUIRED, string): Courier partner account name configured on the Clickpost dashboard
  - manually_update_status (query, optional, boolean): If the value of this field is "True" then Clickpost will update the tracking status of AWB to "Cancelled" manually once a successful response is received from the courier partner.

Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Success ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"message\": \"SUCCESS\",\n        \"success\": true,\n        \"status\": 600\n    }\n}"

      --- Scenario: Order Already Cancelled ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"message\": \"ORDER ALREADY CANCELLED\",\n        \"success\": true,\n        \"status\": 600\n    }\n}"

      --- Scenario: Account does not exist/Invalid carrier partner ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 351,\n        \"message\": \"Clickpost Account: Does not exist\",\n        \"success\": false\n    }\n}"

  Status 400: 400
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Invalid/Non-existent Waybill ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"message\": \"Invalid Waybill/ Waybill cannot be cancelled\",\n        \"success\": false,\n        \"status\": 350\n    }\n}"

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: GET /v1/ndr_user_feedback/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/ndr_user_feedback/

Summary: Customer Feedback
Description: This API enables customers to retrieve feedback from end-users in case of failure of delivery of any shipment. Users can update their preferred location of delivery at Clickpost Tracking Page, and those changes are retrieved by this API.

Parameters:
  - username (query, REQUIRED, string): The username of the clickpost dashboard
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): API key given to enterprise by the clickpost onboarding team
  - start_date (query, REQUIRED, integer): Epoch time (in secs) of start of the period in which the feedbacks were provided
  - end_date (query, REQUIRED, integer): Epoch time (in secs) of end of the period in which the feedbacks were provided

Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Result ---
      "{
    "result": [
        {
            "type": "CUSTOMER_FEED",
            "awb": "2667237490164",
            "address": "ABCD Street",
            "landmark": "Pokaran",
            "drop_pincode": null,
            "preferred_date": "2022-10-27",

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: POST /v3/create-order/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v3/create-order/

Summary: Create Order: India
Description: This API takes the shipment details, drop information, pickup information and creates an order with specified carrier partner. Works only for shipments created and transported within India.

Parameters:
  - username (query, REQUIRED, string): Username, unique to the enterprise profile
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Unique key to verify/authenticate the enterprise profile

Request Body:
  Content-Type: application/json
  Schema Fields:
    - RAW_BODY (string) [REQUIRED]: Payload of the request, containing all details of the order

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: GET /v1/shipment-security-key
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/shipment-security-key

Summary: Fetch shipment security key
Description: Fetch shipment security key API give the security key for each shipment that you can consume and store corresponding to a shipment in the system.

This security key is useful if you have the security feature enabled on Clickpost's tracking page. If the security feature is enabled on your Clickpost tracking page, you need to ensure you consume the shipment security key and pass it in URL param key= while rendering the tracking page at your end.

Parameters:
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): API key given to enterprise by the clickpost onboarding team
  - waybill (query, REQUIRED, string): Airway bill number for which the security key needs to be fetched
  - cp_id (query, REQUIRED, string): Carrier Partner ID (https://track.clickpost.in/courier_partner)

Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Success ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 200,\n        \"message\": \"Success\",\n        \"success\": true\n    },\n    \"result\": {\n        \"waybill\": \"19025410024065\",\n        \"cp_id\": 4,\n        \"security_key\": \"c020a025-9511-4a46-b1bd-31e87ad64c65\",\n        \"reference_number\": \"CR61622155\"\n    }\n}"

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: POST /v1/enable_shipment_notification/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/enable_shipment_notification/

Summary: Whatsapp opt-out/opt-in API
Description: The WhatsApp opt-in API allows you to inform Clickpost systems if WhatsApp communication shall be enabled/disabled for a particular shipment.

Parameters:
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Unique license key of the customer, used for authentication

Request Body:
  Content-Type: application/json
  Schema Fields:
    - RAW_BODY (string) [optional]: 

  Request Examples:
    --- Scenario: Enable Whatsapp Notification ---
{
  "awb": "<awb_number>",
  "whatsapp_disable": true
}


Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Result ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"success\": true,\n        \"status\": 200,\n        \"message\": \"SUCCESS\"\n    }\n}"

  Status 400: 400
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Result ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 400,\n        \"message\": \"<error message>\",\n        \"success\": false\n    }\n}"

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: GET /v1/updated-order
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/updated-order

Summary: Fetch updated shipment list
Description: The API retrieves the latest shipment tracking status updates between the specified start and end time. This API takes the start date and end date and returns the data for all the AWBs which were updated during this time period

Parameters:
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Enter the API key given to you by the clickpost onboarding team
  - username (query, REQUIRED, string): Clickpost API Username: Provided by Clickpost Team
  - start_date (query, REQUIRED, string): start time in epoch (seconds). Example: 1616580960
  - end_date (query, REQUIRED, string): end time in epoch (seconds). Difference between start time and end time cannot be greater than 1800 seconds(30 mins)

Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: SUCCESS ---
      "{

        "success": true,

    },

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: POST /v1/reports/enterprise_dashboard_report/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/reports/enterprise_dashboard_report/

Summary: Report Request
Description: Using this API, you can fetch all the shipment updates received for a day in Clickpost.

The start time and end time are in UTC.

Parameters:
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Enter the API key given to you by the clickpost onboarding team

Request Body:
  Content-Type: application/json
  Schema Fields:
    - RAW_BODY (string) [REQUIRED]: Enter the request body

  Request Examples:
    --- Scenario: Report Request Payload ---
{
  "filters": {
    "updated_at_start_time": "2021-12-17 00:00:00",
    "updated_at_end_time": "2021-12-17 23:59:00"
  },
  "report_name": "TRACK_ORDER_DASHBOARD_REPORT",
  "fields": []
}

    --- Scenario: Report Request with Fields Filter ---
{
  "filters": {
    "updated_at_start_time": "2021-12-17 00:00:00",
    "updated_at_end_time": "2021-12-17 23:59:00"
  },
  "report_name": "TRACK_ORDER_DASHBOARD_REPORT",
  "fields": []
}


Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: SUCCESS ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 200,\n        \"message\": \"Success\",\n        \"success\": true\n    },\n    \"result\": [\n        {\n            \"report_name\": \"TRACK_ORDER_DASHBOARD_REPORT\",\n            \"report_reference_number\": 1324696,\n            \"report_created_at\": \"2022-11-04 06:06\"\n        }\n    ]\n}"

      --- Scenario: Authentication Failed ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 301,\n        \"message\": \"Authentication Failed: Invalid Token or API Key\",\n        \"success\": false\n    }\n}"

  Status 400: 400
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Result ---
      "{}"

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: GET /v1/return_order_poll/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/return_order_poll/

Summary: Returns Polling Delta API
Description: The Return Polling Delta API is used to fetch all the return requests raised in the Clickpost system in a 60 minute window. This can be considered as a fallback mechanism to the Return Request Received Webhook mentioned above that is already in place to share this data.

Parameters:
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Enter the API key given to you by the clickpost onboarding team
  - user_name (query, REQUIRED, string): Username of the Enterprise given Clickpost team
  - start_time (query, REQUIRED, string): Start time for which the returns needs to be retrieved
  - end_time (query, REQUIRED, string): End time for which the returns needs to be retrieved

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: POST /v2/create-pickup/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v2/create-pickup/

Summary: Pickup Request: Rest of the World
Description: Given all pickup and carriers partner details, create a new pickup request for select carriers. Applicable for all worldwide and cross-border shipments.

Parameters:
  - username (query, REQUIRED, string): Username, unique to the enterprise profile
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Unique key to verify/authenticate the enterprise profile

Request Body:
  Content-Type: application/json
  Schema Fields:
    - RAW_BODY (string) [optional]: Payload of the request, containing all details of the order

  Request Examples:
    --- Scenario: Sample Request ---
{
  "shipment_details": {
    "reference_number": "TestDHLME000001",
    "awb_number": "6276148141",
    "courier_partner_id": 159,
    "account_code": "1",
    "items": [
      {
        "sku": "S159SV8TAUXL",
        "price": 85.12,
        "weight": 2,
        "quantity": 1,
        "description": "Recycled Flared Legging - Regular",
        "height": 1,
        "length": 1,
        "breadth": 1
      }
    ],
    "height": 1,
    "length": 1,
    "weight": 10,
    "breadth": 1
  },
  "pickup_info": {
    "date": "2022-11-11",
    "start_time": "10:45",
    "end_time": "11:05",
    "email": "test@clickpost.in",
    "phone": "8080808080",
    "phone_code": "+91",
    "name": "Warehouse Pickup POC",
    "address": "Test Pickup Warehouse Address, Pickup Locality, ",
    "city": "Test City",
    "state": "ABCD",
    "country_code": "IN",
    "postal_code": 123456
  }
}


Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Successful Response ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"message\": \"SUCCESS\",\n        \"success\": true,\n        \"status\": 200\n    },\n    \"result\": {\n        \"confirmation_number\": \"CBJ221111679550\"\n    }\n}"

      --- Scenario: AWB Number not Registered ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 400,\n        \"message\": {\n            \"non_field_errors\": [\n                \"627618141 not registered against account code 1\"\n            ]\n        },\n        \"success\": false\n    }\n}"

      --- Scenario: Invalid Account Code ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 400,\n        \"message\": {\n            \"non_field_errors\": [\n                \": invalid Account Code 8\"\n            ]\n        },\n        \"success\": false\n    }\n}"

metadata.summary: Pickup Request: Rest of the World

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: GET /v2/pincode_details/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v2/pincode_details/

Summary: Pincode to City and State API
Description: The API takes the 6 digit Indian pincode and returns the corresponding city and state

Parameters:
  - pincode (query, REQUIRED, string): valid 6 digit Indian pincode
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Clickpost API Key

Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Valid Pincode ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"success\": true,\n        \"status\": 200,\n        \"message\": \"Success\"\n    },\n    \"result\": {\n        \"pincode\": \"380055\",\n        \"city\": \"AHMEDABAD\",\n        \"state\": \"GUJARAT\"\n    }\n}"

      --- Scenario: Invalid Pincode ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"success\": false,\n        \"status\": 404,\n        \"message\": \"Not found: 3800115\"\n    },\n    \"result\": {}\n}"

metadata.summary: Pincode to City and State API

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: GET /v1/fetch/shippinglabel/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/fetch/shippinglabel/

Summary: Fetch Shipping Label

Parameters:
  - username (query, REQUIRED, string): Clickpost account username: you ll get it from your Clickpost relationship manager
  - key (query, REQUIRED, string): Unique API key for your Clickpost account. Will be shared by your Clickpost relationship manager
  - waybill (query, REQUIRED, string): Unique airway bill number or tracking ID provided by the carrier for the shipment
  - cp_id (query, REQUIRED, integer): Clickpost's Courier Partner ID: https://track.clickpost.in/courier_partner
  - regenerate (query, optional, string): Will always be false if you wish to fetch earlier generated label. If you pass regenerate=true, Clickpost systems will try to fetch the label again from carriers and share it [Not recommended]. Always pass regenerate=false unless recommended by your Clickpost relationship manager

Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Success ---
      "{\n  \"meta\": {\n    \"success\": true,\n    \"status\": 200,\n    \"message\": \"SUCCESS\"\n  },\n  \"result\": {\n    \"shipping_label\": \"<shipping_label_URL>\"\n  }\n}"

      --- Scenario: Failure 1 ---
      "{\n  \"meta\": {\n    \"status\": 500,\n    \"message\": \"Ops! Internal server error in Clickpost\",\n    \"success\": false\n  }\n}"

      --- Scenario: Failure 2 ---
      "{\n    \"meta\": {\n        \"status\": 301,\n        \"message\": \"Authentication Failed: Invalid Token or API Key\",\n        \"success\": false\n    }\n}"

API: Clickpost
Endpoint: POST /v1/user/token/
Full URL: https://www.clickpost.in/api/v1/user/token/

Summary: Token based authentication
Description: This API allows you to generate an access token using a username and password

Request Body:
  Content-Type: application/json
  Schema Fields:
    - username (string) [optional]: Username of the enterprise account
    - password (string) [optional]: Password of the user of the enterprise account

Responses:
  Status 200: 200
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Result ---
      "{\"token\":\"1123123123123123106\",\"expires_at\":\"2025-03-28T11:12:07\"}"

  Status 400: 400
    Examples (application/json):
      --- Scenario: Result ---
      "{}"
